Sentence: Edward sends Warwick to France to ask for the hand of the king of France's sister, and Margaret goes to France to ask for aid against Edward
George is so upset by Edward's new marriage that he (Edward) leaves with Somerset to join with Warwick
Seeing George on the enemy's side, Edward gives up the throne and consents to be imprisoned at Warwick's brother's estate
Edward and Richard capture Henry and send him (Edward) to the Tower before they march to meet Warwick's army
Edward's army meets Warwick's forces, and Edward asks Warwick if he (Edward) will again swear allegiance to him (Edward)
